pDescr:
Color:Animal Friends - Blue
Keep baby calm and content, with this mesmerizing mobile. Adorable, colorful animal friends, with black and white geometric designs. 30 minutes of continuous minutes. Fits most pack and play, travel cribs, strollers, infants seats and bassinetts. Mobile arm seperates for easy carry in any diaper bag.
pTitle: Tiny Love Take Along Mobile, Animal Friends, Blue
rText:
The mobile itself is perfection - music selection is wonderful, mobile characters are bright and cheerful, and love the hanging options (clip, Velcro strap or arm). However, I deducted one star for the arm. The arch width is too short to hang from the crib for baby to lie beneath it. Baby has to be pretty much up against the crib rails. Also, the fastening mechanism on the arm does not grip tightly enough on fabric covered tubes (I.e. Play yard arms or rock n sleeper). I had read positive and negative reviews about that and after trying it, agree that is a problem. I can get it to grip tightly but the weight of the mobile gradually pulls the arm over, either on floor or (gasp!) baby.

Otherwise, love the mobile! Works well on car seat, stroller and play yard (Velcro strap on play yard's own mobile arch).

rText: Seems to work great for what it's supposed to do! Fits on crib nicely and seems steady. I haven't used the actual arms to hang anything from but instead fitted my pre-made mobile over the top part and hung it that way. Added bonus it comes with a music device too.

pDescr:
Color:Meadow Days
The Soothe 'n Groove Mobile is an ingenious way to entertain your child from baby through to toddler both at home and on the go. This mobile is two items in one. It grows with your baby from a crib mobile to a stand-alone music box that toddlers can carry on their own. With six different musical categories and 18 different tunes, there's up to 40 minutes of continuous and non-repeating music for your child to enjoy. The special soothing motion of the mobile captures baby's attention and keeps them engaged, and colorful buttons allow your child to activate and change the music on their own. The unique design features two high quality speakers for great sound and easy to control volume.
pTitle: Tiny Love Meadow Days Soothe 'n Groove Mobile
rText: We bought this mobile in Feb. 2017. My daughter loved it. Within the last week, it's stopped working. We replaced the batteries, but it still doesn't work. I've contacted the company through their website and am waiting to hear back. I'm very disappointed that the mobile has died already. We only used it for approximately five to 10 minutes a day.

rText:
Hands down, the best baby purchase I've ever made! My daughter is 3 months old and is very fussy. She wants to be held all of the time and cries the moment you put her down. This amazing apparatus has kept my daughter occupied long enough for me to get chores done around the house, cook dinner, and even enjoy a bit of mommy time.
Bonus: only took me a few minutes to put together.
I was torn between purchasing this mobile and the Skip Hop Moonlight & Melodies mobile (it has a remote). So glad I chose this one. Better reviews and cheaper!

pTitle: Tiny Love Meadow Days Soothe 'n Groove Mobile
rText:
I purchased this mobile thanks to a friend's recommendation. I will admit that I did not think it was as cute as some of the other mobile designs I'd seen, but there were a few major selling points:

-The music plays for over 40 minutes. Some units play for a very brief time, and if you have a fussy baby, the last thing you want to do is go in and keep turning on the music!
-The longevity. Once your baby is able to stand in the crib, you can detach the mobile and continue to use it as a music box in the crib or beyond. As a first-time mom, I wondered whether a child would carry it around as shown in the pictures, but my son is 3.5 years old and it helped him transition to a big-kid bed and it continues to soothe him to sleep when he's restless.
-The music is pleasant. Our son gravitated to the classical setting as soon as he was able to figure out which button was which.
-The portability. We have easily taken this with us on vacations to help our son sleep in an unfamiliar setting.

Considering that we have now been using this mobile for 3.5 years, religiously, it is still working perfectly and I have only replaced the batteries three or four times. The only two things that might have improved this item in my eyes is if the music was all more soothing (some pieces are a bit lively for bedtime, in my opinion), and if it had a remote control (for during those long sleep training nights!). But I can say that this was hands down one of our best purchases when our son was born!
rTitle: Son still uses it to sleep at 3.5 years old!

pDescr:
Color:Meadow Days
The Soothe 'n Groove Mobile is an ingenious way to entertain your child from baby through to toddler both at home and on the go. This mobile is two items in one. It grows with your baby from a crib mobile to a stand-alone music box that toddlers can carry on their own. With six different musical categories and 18 different tunes, there's up to 40 minutes of continuous and non-repeating music for your child to enjoy. The special soothing motion of the mobile captures baby's attention and keeps them engaged, and colorful buttons allow your child to activate and change the music on their own. The unique design features two high quality speakers for great sound and easy to control volume.
pTitle: Tiny Love Meadow Days Soothe 'n Groove Mobile
rText: Overall I say it's a great buy and I was far from disappointed. Infact Im very happy with this purchase. I guess it matches our woodland theme and it looks just what it is in the picture online. It has many songs to choose from and so far it is made of good quality although our baby is coming in a few weeks.

rText: I love this little thing. The mobile we bought was a crank only. It didn't last long at all, maybe 2 minutes with lots of turns, and it was broken at one part of the song. It shuts off on its own, its got a volume setting so you can even mute it if you just want it to spin, and the music is easy to listen to when you're new, overtired parents! Unfortunately it keeps our baby awake now, so we don't really use it, but when we did use it, it worked like a charm!

pTitle: SHILOH Baby Musical Mobile Battery-operated 60 Songs White
rText:
Note: you need a base for this.

I bought a mobile with a hand crank and it only lasts a couple minutes. Totally not long enough to eat a small meal. I use the base to hold this model.

This thing is great; adjustable volume, huge music selection. I take it off the base and use it during bathtime.

FYI, a lot of the songs are from Japanese media. I was not aware of this when I bought it. It has a lot of ghibli anime, and Japanese artists that are ated using musical box notes. A full list can be found on the pictures.
Not a complaint. Just a note.

pTitle: SHILOH Baby Musical Mobile Battery-operated 60 Songs White
rText: Brilliant, brilliant, brilliant. I couldn't stand winding my daughter's other mobile every 2-3 minutes. Now, she sits under this battery-operated mobile and watches butterflies circle round and round. She is absolutely enthralled with her mobile ... so much so that she gets very excited watching it and won't go to sleep. She laughs and kicks her feet for 30 minutes. Music quality is great, and I like that it lasts about 30 minutes. The mobile is also powerful enough to keep her butterflies circulating, even though they often bump into the main pole on her current mobile setup -- the old crank version constantly hung up. Was very surprised that they sent me an entire new mobile arm along with the battery-operated music part. I thought I was just paying for the music box -- they could have saved their money and not sent the mobile arm etc.

pTitle: SHILOH Baby Musical Mobile Battery-operated 60 Songs White
rText:
First the good:
1. Lovely music- not tinny sounding at all.
2. Easy controls- one side controls the music, the other controls rotation.
3. The number of songs certainly makes for interesting listening...especially when you're listening to it for the 100th time and the baby still isn't asleep!
4. Fits on a standard crib mobile arm.
5. You can have music only by switching off the rotation or rotation only by reducing the music volume.
6. The auto shut-off is great to save battery!
The not so good:
1. The rotation works only occasionally! Sometimes you can manually turn the hook a couple of times and that gets it going. But it seems completely random :(
2. When the rotation does work, it drains the battery very quick. I could live with this, if the rotation actually worked all the time.
rTitle: Music: Good. Rotation: Iffy at best.

pTitle: SHILOH Baby Musical Mobile Battery-operated 60 Songs White
rText:
This is one of those "I usually don't write reviews, but had to for this product" reviews. This is a very good baby mobile music and rotating device. It works absolutely perfect. Very, very, very good for the price.

The songs are really nice, and there are so many. Most baby devices that have music have a handful of mostly crappy songs. This has 60 very good songs that change automatically about every minute.

The fact that you can have the music but not the rotation, or have the rotation but not the music is really great.

I paired this with what I think is THE only baby mobile to buy. The: Manhattan Toy Wimmer-Ferguson Infant Stim-Mobile for Cribs. That mobile is really a very stimulating mobile FOR THE BABY. None of this fluffy suffed animals that the parent sees but all the baby sees is the bottom of the stuffed animal. Here is the link for the mobile on Amazon: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00W89SX2S/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o08_s01?ie=UTF8&psc=1

This GREAT musical, rotating device combined with the above mentioned mobile is really the perfect combination for your baby.

I have attached a video where you can hear the music (kind of) and see the rotation as well as see the baby mobile I refer to above. You can really see him following each one as it goes by. By the way, he was 4 weeks old at the time of the video

pDescr:
Patented product & Self-owned brand

Product Details

1. For your newborn baby. The mobile can play 60 soothing pure and light songs, which helps develop your baby's ability to recognize sounds and stimulate your baby's linguistic faculties 

2. Listening to music will help teach your baby about rhythm beat and tone which are useful

3.Sweet way to help baby sleep with soothing music. Keep baby calm and content

4. The volume of music can be adjusted 

Just turn it on and it will go on for a set amount of time (30minutes) and then it will automatically shut off.
5. One unit= 60 songs musical box

6. Due to the difference between different monitors, the picture may not reflect the actual color of the item. Thank you! 


Musical box Features 
1. Ultralong play

2. ABS safe material

3. Music and spin separately controlled

4. Volume Up/Low music Next/Previous Buttons

5. Automatically turns off after 30 minutes without touch

6. Break-point memory
pTitle: SHILOH Baby Musical Mobile Battery-operated 60 Songs White
rText: We loved the music it played, it was very soothing but it stopped working about a month after owning it. Unfortunately we didn't realize it was more than just dead batteries until after the return window.
rTitle: We loved the music it played

pDescr:
Product Packaging:Standard Packaging
Product Description
Animal friends from around the planet twirl and smile down at baby as music plays and a fascinating light show dances up above. The delicate canopy keeps images close, so it’s easier for young babies to focus. As baby grows, you can remove the mobile and project the show on the ceiling, with sweet music or sounds playing along. Includes remote control.

Amazon.com
Designed for use from birth up to five months, the Fisher-Price Precious Planet Two-in-One Projection Mobile is unique among mobiles, because it combines music, plush animal figurines, and movement with a soft projection of light. Both entertaining and soothing, the Projection Mobile is perfect for playtime and rest time. It includes a remote control and requires two "AAA" and four "D" batteries.


	Images project on canopy for younger babies.

	Converts to music box with ceiling projection for older babies.

	Innovative attaching method fits more cribs!


	Restart the mobile without disturbing baby!



Fun, Colorful Design with Music and Lights to Keep Your Baby Entertained
The Projection Mobile features a colorful animal-themed design, sweet music, and a fascinating light show that dances up above. The delicate canopy keeps images close, making it easy for young babies to focus. And when your baby grows, you can remove the mobile and project the show directly on the ceiling, with music or sounds playing along to add to the fun.
Four Plush Characters Promote Brain Development
To help your baby learn to focus and to support healthy visual development, the Projection Mobile includes four plush animal toys with spinning antics that are sure to delight and calm your baby. A teal whale, white polar bear, green alligator, and yellow lion keep your baby interested with their detailed designs and friendly faces. Babies will want to reach up to touch one or all, and parents can join in the fun by naming each animal and explaining where it lives.

Three Musical Settings to Match Your Baby's Moods
As your baby watches the animal antics, you can choose up to a full 20 minutes of music to either soothe or engage her senses and to help develop her auditory skills. Customize your baby's experience and match her mood by choosing from classical lullabies from Bach, Beethoven, and Mozart, nature and ocean sounds, or heartbeat and white noise womb sounds.

The Projection Mobile measures 23.5 x 17.0 x 18.0 inches (WxHxD) and weighs just five pounds. It attaches securely to any crib with an improved, stable mechanism, and it comes with a remote control. To operate, the mobile requires four "D" batteries, while the remote requires two "AAA" batteries.


About Fisher-Price: Over 75 Years of Delighting Children with Fun, Safe Toys
A subsidiary of Mattel, Inc., Fisher-Price manufactures a range of fun, educational, and developmentally appropriate toys for babies, toddlers, and preschoolers. Founded in 1930 by Herman Fisher, Irving Price, Margaret Evans Price, and Helen Schelle, Fisher-Price has created approximately 5,000 different toys. Now headquartered in East Aurora New York, Fisher-Price's guiding principles haven't changed. The company still focuses on each toy's intrinsic play value, innovation, and safe and sturdy construction. Some of Fisher-Price's top-selling lines include the Little People toys, Power Wheels, and the Chatter Telephone, as well as an assortment of Disney, Sesame Street, and Barney toys marketed under the company name. Fisher-Price also designs and sells infant care products and electronic toys for preschoolers.

pTitle: Fisher-Price Precious Planet 2-in-1 Projection Mobile
rText: I was excited about this with all the great reviews. Upon receiving this item I put it together. Tested it before putting it on the crib. Immediately upon turning it on there was smoke and a burning smell. The music and the lights worked however it did not turn. I did not want to risk replacing this item and having this happen again in my baby's room near him while sleeping so I returned the item.

rText:
I just assembled and attached it to the crib. The buttons for on/off and volume control are in a terrible location! If I put the mobile where I want it I can't see the buttons and the buttons are flush so it makes it hard to change them.
Also, to replace the batteries on the mobile you have to remove the whole unit. Poor design!

pTitle: Fisher-Price Precious Planet 2-in-1 Projection Mobile
rText: The product needs to be assembled. It is in about 7 pieces. It is very simple to put together. The one thing I didn't realize or think about was ordering batteries along with the product. Luckily, I had some so I was able to play it right away. The mobile needs 3 D batteries and the remote needs 2 AA batteries. The remote is a great feature, but I have not needed to use it. The crib is right next to our bed so I just press the button on the mobile. Once our baby is old enough to be in his own room the remote will come in handy. Plus there is a feature to take off the "umbrella" part as the child gets old and can stand and pull at it. Overall, I love this mobile.
rTitle: Just what I was looking for

pTitle: Fisher-Price Precious Planet 2-in-1 Projection Mobile
rText: We've had this attached to our son's crib since day 1, and he loves it. He likes to watch the animals and the reflected ones. The music melodies are soft and soothing, though it never puts him to sleep. It does help make him drowsy, which then helps us put him to sleep. The mobile was easy to put together and attach to the crib, but there is a clicking sound that occurs every few rotations of the animals. It's not loud, and doesn't seem as noisy as other reviewers have said, but I find it to be annoying. It doesn't seem to bother my baby though. I wish it didn't make th sound though, and I wish the arm of the mobile extended a little farther out. I have to place my baby's head pretty far up in the crib so he can watch the reflected images properly.
rTitle: Baby loves it but clicking noise

pTitle: Fisher-Price Precious Planet 2-in-1 Projection Mobile
rText: I'm going to totally honest about this product, my wife and I were so excited to purchase this for our infant daughter. She love pretty much anything that hangs in the air so I felt hey I'll fork over the more pricey one for her. She has got to love it! Well when I open the box it was package really bad but did not see any damage from what I could see. Put this product together and found out for one the reflector for where the light illuminates is horribly placed and it barely lights up even in the pitch black. This was the main team why I purshased this product was for my daughter to be able to see the hanging animals spin at night. Nope I guess not! Second the machine takes 4 large D batteries which is fine, but it seems to really drain the batteries really quick. In the end could be more costly. And finally last I'm just alll in all un happy with this product we love Fisher Price Products so hopefully we can get over this upset for the price tag on this. I would like to also add when left on the machine seems to get really warm from the mechanics of things. All in all my daughter has no interest in this toy which is a real bummer for my wife and I.

pDescr:
Product Packaging:Standard Packaging
Product Description
Animal friends from around the planet twirl and smile down at baby as music plays and a fascinating light show dances up above. The delicate canopy keeps images close, so it’s easier for young babies to focus. As baby grows, you can remove the mobile and project the show on the ceiling, with sweet music or sounds playing along. Includes remote control.

Amazon.com
Designed for use from birth up to five months, the Fisher-Price Precious Planet Two-in-One Projection Mobile is unique among mobiles, because it combines music, plush animal figurines, and movement with a soft projection of light. Both entertaining and soothing, the Projection Mobile is perfect for playtime and rest time. It includes a remote control and requires two "AAA" and four "D" batteries.


	Images project on canopy for younger babies.

	Converts to music box with ceiling projection for older babies.

	Innovative attaching method fits more cribs!


	Restart the mobile without disturbing baby!



Fun, Colorful Design with Music and Lights to Keep Your Baby Entertained
The Projection Mobile features a colorful animal-themed design, sweet music, and a fascinating light show that dances up above. The delicate canopy keeps images close, making it easy for young babies to focus. And when your baby grows, you can remove the mobile and project the show directly on the ceiling, with music or sounds playing along to add to the fun.
Four Plush Characters Promote Brain Development
To help your baby learn to focus and to support healthy visual development, the Projection Mobile includes four plush animal toys with spinning antics that are sure to delight and calm your baby. A teal whale, white polar bear, green alligator, and yellow lion keep your baby interested with their detailed designs and friendly faces. Babies will want to reach up to touch one or all, and parents can join in the fun by naming each animal and explaining where it lives.

Three Musical Settings to Match Your Baby's Moods
As your baby watches the animal antics, you can choose up to a full 20 minutes of music to either soothe or engage her senses and to help develop her auditory skills. Customize your baby's experience and match her mood by choosing from classical lullabies from Bach, Beethoven, and Mozart, nature and ocean sounds, or heartbeat and white noise womb sounds.

The Projection Mobile measures 23.5 x 17.0 x 18.0 inches (WxHxD) and weighs just five pounds. It attaches securely to any crib with an improved, stable mechanism, and it comes with a remote control. To operate, the mobile requires four "D" batteries, while the remote requires two "AAA" batteries.


About Fisher-Price: Over 75 Years of Delighting Children with Fun, Safe Toys
A subsidiary of Mattel, Inc., Fisher-Price manufactures a range of fun, educational, and developmentally appropriate toys for babies, toddlers, and preschoolers. Founded in 1930 by Herman Fisher, Irving Price, Margaret Evans Price, and Helen Schelle, Fisher-Price has created approximately 5,000 different toys. Now headquartered in East Aurora New York, Fisher-Price's guiding principles haven't changed. The company still focuses on each toy's intrinsic play value, innovation, and safe and sturdy construction. Some of Fisher-Price's top-selling lines include the Little People toys, Power Wheels, and the Chatter Telephone, as well as an assortment of Disney, Sesame Street, and Barney toys marketed under the company name. Fisher-Price also designs and sells infant care products and electronic toys for preschoolers.

pTitle: Fisher-Price Precious Planet 2-in-1 Projection Mobile
rText: This mobile is amazing. My 2 month old baby absolutely loves it. It provides her a lot of stimulation and entertainment and it's great for when I need a few moments during the day. It's very easy to assemble, the animals face down towards your child, and the music and projector are great. Plus, the remote is a nice bonus. Great product!

pDescr:
Color:Meadow Days
The Tiny Love Stroller Arch's colorful toys are perfect for stimulating your newborn's vision. As your baby grows the toys are great for practicing hand-eye coordination. At first babies will randomly bat the toys causing them to sway, but they'll gradually learn to control their hands and manage to bat the toys deliberately. The toys are designed to be easily held and will stand up to the mouth exploration and gumming babies love to give. The flexibility of the Sunny Stroll allows you to moderate the level of stimulation offered with a simple adjustment the arch to alter the toys that are within your baby's field of vision. You can also fold the arch in a way that allows your baby to focus on just one or two of the toys if you feel they are becoming overstimulated. The adjustable arch is also designed to adapt to a variety of stroller styles and attaches easily with the universal clip.

pTitle: Tiny Love Meadow Days Sunny Stroll Stroller Arch
rText:
As many other customers did, we bought this to put on our Baby Bjorn Bouncer. I actually got both this and the Baby Bjorn Wooden toy that pairs with the bouncer. So for others also looking at the pros and cons of both items, here's the low-down.

This is a fun and colorful toy. With its plastic clamps, it can be added to many different baby-holders (car seats, activity gyms, high chairs etc.). It has articulated ball joints, so you can adjust how close or far it is leaning over a baby. The toys on it are colorful and bright. There's a lot of different sensory items here with different materials to feel, different sounds and more. However, it does look a bit gaudy, and, for son, it can be over-stimulating and he can get overwhelmed and start to fuss. If we have him play with it at a time he is well-rested, and alert, he can last longer with it,a nd I've noticed he enjoys it more as he has grown older. I felt this item might work better if your child is already fairly good at gripping and/or is 5+ months.

We get more use from the wooden bjorn toy, but for the price, felt this was still a good buy as we can easily change the two out, thus adding more novelty.
rTitle: This is a fun and colorful toy

Color:Meadow Days

At first babies will randomly bat the toys causing them to sway, but they'll gradually learn to control their hands and manage to bat the toys deliberately. The toys are designed to be easily held and will stand up to the mouth exploration and gumming babies love to give. The flexibility of the Sunny Stroll allows you to moderate the level of stimulation offered with a simple adjustment the arch to alter the toys that are within your baby's field of vision. You can also fold the arch in a way that allows your baby to focus on just one or two of the toys if you feel they are becoming overstimulated. The adjustable arch is also designed to adapt to a variety of stroller styles and attaches easily with the universal clip.
pTitle: Tiny Love Meadow Days Sunny Stroll Stroller Arch
rText: My baby loves it!

pDescr:
Product Description
Rainforest Friends 3-in-1 Deluxe Projection Mobile "grows" with baby from a motorized crib mobile with starry light show projection and 3 soothing audio modes.to a table top projection soother for extended use outside the crib, plus a linkable stroller mobile for on the go. Three plush animal friends on the motorized crib mobile help soothe, comfort and entertain baby. The animals gently float overhead as a soft-glow starry light show projects on the ceiling and walls, surrounding baby with soothing sights just right for developing visual skills. Three audio modes add up to 30 minutes of lullaby music, white noise or soothing nature sounds, too. Remote control is designed to hang on the nursery door knob, so you can quickly restart mobile motion, projection and audio without disturbing baby. When baby outgrows a crib mobile, Rainforest Friends 3-in-1 Deluxe Projection Mobile converts to a table top musical projection soother for older babies and toddlers, and a linkable stroller mobile. Clip it to your stroller's canopy to take the mobile on the go.

Brand Story
By Fisher Price

pTitle: Fisher-Price Deluxe Projection Mobile, Rainforest Friends 3-in-1
rText: My daughter loves this mobile! The star lights are great in a dark room and the animals are bright and colorful and face down toward the baby instead of baby staring at their underbellies. The battery life on this thing is great too! Installation was pretty easy and it feels very secure. The straps are soft enough that I don't think they will damage the wood finish of the crib.
rTitle: Attachment won't damage crib, Animals face baby!

pTitle: Fisher-Price Deluxe Projection Mobile, Rainforest Friends 3-in-1
rText: The description says that the animals rotate, but they do not. I am reading other comments from parents and how they fixed it. I am not that talented; it's probably more likely that I could levitate a stuffed animal over my precious baby than to fix a design flaw. Along to the rescue my hubby stepped in with a screw driver to tighten the bottom of the light thingie and wah-la....the little critters are spinning and mom and baby are fixated and happy. Dad is proud! This was a win win moment. No thx to the manufacturer. Hang in there parents.

pTitle: Fisher-Price Deluxe Projection Mobile, Rainforest Friends 3-in-1
rText: After reading quite a few not so good reviews I decided I was going to try it anyway, as it was what I was looking for. Some of the not so good reviews said that it kept on falling off on top of the baby, so my initial concern was to make sure it was properly installed on the baby and nice and tight. Well, it's been there for a few months now and it's never fallen off, even with my little one now trying to tug at the hanging toys. I love it through and through! The melodies are nice and soothing and put my baby to sleep (not an easy feat) and they last just long enough - there are two possible levels of sound (we only use the lowest one and find it ideal). The remote is also handy but we ended up not using it much, though it's still nice to have. The projected stars are great, with not too much light, just enough to keep the baby interested but not too much so that he doesn't fall asleep. Also, the batteries last quite awhile (around 4 months) and we use it everyday, several times a day. This product is worth every cent! I definitely recommend it to any parents, especially the ones with fussy babies such as us :).

pDescr:
Product Description
Rainforest Friends 3-in-1 Deluxe Projection Mobile "grows" with baby from a motorized crib mobile with starry light show projection and 3 soothing audio modes.to a table top projection soother for extended use outside the crib, plus a linkable stroller mobile for on the go. Three plush animal friends on the motorized crib mobile help soothe, comfort and entertain baby. The animals gently float overhead as a soft-glow starry light show projects on the ceiling and walls, surrounding baby with soothing sights just right for developing visual skills. Three audio modes add up to 30 minutes of lullaby music, white noise or soothing nature sounds, too. Remote control is designed to hang on the nursery door knob, so you can quickly restart mobile motion, projection and audio without disturbing baby. When baby outgrows a crib mobile, Rainforest Friends 3-in-1 Deluxe Projection Mobile converts to a table top musical projection soother for older babies and toddlers, and a linkable stroller mobile. pTitle: Fisher-Price Deluxe Projection Mobile, Rainforest Friends 3-in-1
rText: I bought this when my daughter was about 3 months old and she is currently 14 months old and the mobile has held up extremely well. My daughter was able to stand in her crib and Pull and yank on the mobile while it was running and I thought she was going to break it, however the mobile has operated as it should be and we have had no issues with it other than replacing batteries. I was very surprised with how well the mobile performed compare to how much my daughter abused it. I would highly recommend this mobile especially if you're looking for something for your child to go to sleep with and you can turn it on for their naps.

rText: I am impressed with this mobile. The quality of the stuffed animals is excellent and it looks great both up close and far away. The music is mostly from cartoons, such as Lion King, My Neighbor Totoro, and Aladdin. There are also some classic lullabies like Green Sleeves. The mobile does spin slowly; the spinning mechanism is inside of the music box. Takes AA batteries.
rTitle: Well made characters, good sound quality

pTitle: SHILOH Baby Developmental Crib Toy With Arm and Musical Mobile Blue Sky
rText: This product was great, and arrived exactly as described, but I was Appalled and Disgusted by the instructions. If BEIJING AIHEWEIXI TRADING CO.,LTD/SHILOH can update the instructions in all products and send me a new copy, then I will keep my product and update my review. Step 6 of assembly in English states, "Twisting the brackets hard as the above picture show. As the new bracket is very tight please let a gentleman do that." I was SHOCKED and offended to read this instruction (see the included picture). Please update the instructions to read, "Hold the brackets firmly in each hand and twist in opposite directions to separate the brackets, as shown in the picture." Honestly, there is absolutely no need to specify gender in these instructions.
rTitle: Great Product -- But Offended by Sexist Instructions...

pDescr: It’s a musical cot mobile, linkable stroller mobile and take-along toy in one! 3-in-1 musical cot mobile with motorized action and four adorable animal friends (three woodland friends on the overhead mobile, plus a musical owl!) comforts and entertains baby at naptime or bedtime. When baby outgrows a cot mobile, Woodland Friends 3-in-1 Musical Mobile converts to a take-along musical owl toy, and a linkable stroller mobile. Clip it to your stroller’s canopy to take baby’s favourite Woodland Friends on the go, and use the musical owl away from home, too, to help soothe and comfort baby with a familiar naptime/nighttime routine.
pTitle: Fisher-Price Woodland Friends 3-in-1 Musical Mobile

rText:
I love this and so did the mom I gave it too. It's great colors for boy or girl and has a couple of functions. I like that you can use it on crib or car. Seems well made. Mobiles get very pricey because most of them try to do too many things in one product. This is simply a nicely made mobile.with a few options like:
"motorized action and up to 20 minutes of lullaby music-Linkable stroller mobile for on-the-go-Take-along musical owl “knows” when it’s on the go & automatically switches to baby-activated music mode with short, fun tunes." It's Fisher Price, so they stand behind it. Go ahead and buyt htis one!

pTitle: Djeco Hanging Mobile, An Unusual Night
rText:
I received this mobile as a gift from my baby registry. I so badly wanted to love it but, as a previous reviewer mentioned, the mobile hangs crooked and the tree tends to collapse. In my case one side was skewed so far that in order for it to hang properly without tangling had to attach metal washers for extra weight.
Since this is for a children's room, I decided against it as the washers present a choking hazard and also it looks pretty tacky with construction materials attached to it...
I wish I had initiated a return and selected something else but I no longer have the packaging. Oh well.
rTitle: I so badly wanted to love it but

pTitle: Djeco Hanging Mobile, An Unusual Night
rText:
Whimsical and magical! A delight for child and adult. We purchased this hanging mobile before Christmas 2016 for my 87 year old mother, who is bedridden with locked-in syndrome. Her eyes opened wide as the eyes of a child, as she gazed upon the sheep in the branch and the cat beneath the cloud that floated around the tree of life with a little red fox hiding behind its trunk. It was a joyful moment for everyone.
Thank you to the makers of this fine imagination toy that is loved by all!

Detailed assembly instructions included.Designed in France.
pTitle: Djeco Hanging Mobile, An Unusual Night
rText: Djeco items are always charming, but this might be the top of the list -- it is an imaginative and dreamy design, easily assembled and put up, and the colors are unusual but not loud. Our baby loves watching it overheard as it drifts around under our ceiling fan. And the white parts are glow in the dark! So beautiful.
rTitle: Beautiful and unusual mobile with great design.

pDescr: Djeco An Unusual Night Mobile Nighty night, sleep tight with this night-themed glow-in-the-dark mobile.Made of 12 die-cut plastic shapesHangs approximately 31" wide by 19" tall.Ships within 1-2 days via USPS Priority from Oregon.Minor assembly required. Detailed assembly instructions included.Designed in France.
pTitle: Djeco Hanging Mobile, An Unusual Night
rText: It doesn't glow as strongly as I would have liked it to but it's good quality and cute. My son likes looking at it. We point things out to him and it captures his interest. I recommend the mobiles from this company.

pDescr: Djeco An Unusual Night Mobile Nighty night, sleep tight with this night-themed glow-in-the-dark mobile.Made of 12 die-cut plastic shapesHangs approximately 31" wide by 19" tall.Ships within 1-2 days via USPS Priority from Oregon.Minor assembly required. Detailed assembly instructions included.Designed in France.
pTitle: Djeco Hanging Mobile, An Unusual Night
rText:
We bought this for my daughter. It is very pretty and looks great in her room. The colors are soothing and appropriate for either gender. It is also an imaginative piece as one could invent many stories or scenarios surrounding the images depicted. It is evocative.

I have a few minor gripes with it:

1. The tree doesn't sit properly and the mobile seems slightly crooked. This is very slight and I no longer notice it. The tree also collapses in on itself a bit.

2. It is not quite as impressive for decoration as my son's Djeco traffic mobile: Djeco - Traffic Mobile, which is much much larger and more colorful with more pieces. I knew this when I bought it, however. The imagery of this one is more evocative.

3. The glow in the dark is cool at first but seems to have faded.

Still, this is beautiful and will add much charm to your child'd room and hopefully will be something to spark his or her imagination as s/he grows.

pDescr: Djeco An Unusual Night Mobile Nighty night, sleep tight with this night-themed glow-in-the-dark mobile.Made of 12 die-cut plastic shapesHangs approximately 31" wide by 19" tall.Ships within 1-2 days via USPS Priority from Oregon.Minor assembly required. Detailed assembly instructions included.Designed in France.
pTitle: Djeco Hanging Mobile, An Unusual Night
rText: Really love this mobile. It has several colorful creatures and a 3D tree. Some parts even glow in the dark once the lights are out which I didn't even know when I made the purchase. I bought 2 other Djeco mobiles and I put this in my son's bedroom so that they can see the mobile glows in the dark when I put them to sleep. Djeco mobiles seems easy to put together and clean and not pricy at all. Highly recommended.

rText: Been looking for something to display photos other than the traditional wall mounted racks. I was so pleased when I came across this mobile. For $10 it's amazing value. Well made and looks perfect in our guest bedroom. I'd highly recommend it.

pDescr:
Style Name:Fan
Turn your loose paper photos, keepsakes, and postcards into an art display with this beautiful photo mobile. The mobile comes equip with several clips to hang your various keepsakes from. A beautiful addition to any space.
pTitle: Kikkerland Mobile Photo Clip Fan, Copper
rText:
Read a lot of reviews here before buying this item. Personally I only liked the geometric shaped mobile and did not care for the shapes of the other mobiles, so to be clear this is for the Geometric Mobile. However after receiving the mobile and assembling it, I don't agree with many of the reviews I read.

Firstly, the item is easy to assemble and of course yes, you need a pair of small nosed pliers, big deal, but aside from that it's as basic as putting a round block into a round hole.

Secondly, I read over and over again in reviews that the item is massive and large and so much larger than expected... well this product was miniature by my standards, and I was in disappointed. The 10 postcards hang in way too close of proximity and are not spaced sufficiently apart, thus the structure is barely large enough to to accommodate the 10 photos.

Also, it is confusing when the seller's specs state that the hanging hardware is not included...as that is ambiguous because you can clearly see the photo attachment clips in the photo ad, but what they mean to say and should qualify is that the hanging hardware to hang the mobile to the ceiling is not included...all this was confusing to me as one reviewer wrote they did not get the "photo clips"...so I didn't think they were going to be included but they were and come attached to the mobile so do not need to be assembled to the mobile and additionally are in a designated spot and you can not move them unless you modify the mobile and want to alter the weight distrubtion.

In conclusion the mobile is very small and the wire thin but I would not call it flimsy as I'm sure it is strong enough to hold ten photos/postcards as advertised, however it does look flimsy and cheap and again I just think the scale is off as the postcards/photo's will touch and or overlap and are not spread out enough to to individually be seen.

The photo ad of the mobile is misleading because it is shot from an angle to accentuate its size and if I bought 5 of these and attached all 5 of them to a larger structure that would be what I would consider large. In the end the seller should be disclosing the dimensions & the size of the triangular attachments.

Just note the triangle from which the photo clips hang are a total width of 6" apart so if you have a postcard or photo that is 4x6 it will hang on an angle and thus the design scale, in my opinion is totally off.
rTitle: Size is relative....seller should inform customers as to its exact dimensions.

pDescr:
Item Package Quantity:1
Product Description
Safely attach crib mobiles with the easy to use Crib Mobile Attachment Clamp. The Crib Mobile Attachment Clamp features large rubber pads that grip the crib railing and protect your crib from scratches and damage left by post and knob style arms. Use the clamp as a replacement for post and knob styles that don't fit all cribs. The crib mobile attachment clamp fits onto both traditional and convertible cribs, including Baby's Dream and specialty and decorative cribs. Can also be used on changing tables. The clamp opens to 2" wide and the arm features a convenient safety button to lock the clamp in position. The quick attach clamp is easy to use simply push on the lever to open the clamp and slide it over the crib railing; the clamp will automatically adjust to the width of the railing. The attachment clamp is portable and perfect for use on vacations. Measures approximately 18" high when assembled. Not recommended for soft or rounded crib railings. Extra assembly require for mobiles with closed attachment loops or closed loops at the top of their music box.

pDescr:
Item Package Quantity:1
Product Description
Safely attach crib mobiles with the easy to use Crib Mobile Attachment Clamp. The Crib Mobile Attachment Clamp features large rubber pads that grip the crib railing and protect your crib from scratches and damage left by post and knob style arms. Use the clamp as a replacement for post and knob styles that don't fit all cribs. The crib mobile attachment clamp fits onto both traditional and convertible cribs, including Baby's Dream and specialty and decorative cribs. Can also be used on changing tables. The clamp opens to 2" wide and the arm features a convenient safety button to lock the clamp in position. The quick attach clamp is easy to use simply push on the lever to open the clamp and slide it over the crib railing; the clamp will automatically adjust to the width of the railing. The attachment clamp is portable and perfect for use on vacations. Measures approximately 18" high when assembled. Not recommended for soft or rounded crib railings. Extra assembly require for mobiles with closed attachment loops or closed loops at the top of their music box.

pDescr:
Item Package Quantity:1
Product Description
Safely attach crib mobiles with the easy to use Crib Mobile Attachment Clamp. The Crib Mobile Attachment Clamp features large rubber pads that grip the crib railing and protect your crib from scratches and damage left by post and knob style arms. Use the clamp as a replacement for post and knob styles that don't fit all cribs. The crib mobile attachment clamp fits onto both traditional and convertible cribs, including Baby's Dream and specialty and decorative cribs. Can also be used on changing tables. The clamp opens to 2" wide and the arm features a convenient safety button to lock the clamp in position. The quick attach clamp is easy to use simply push on the lever to open the clamp and slide it over the crib railing; the clamp will automatically adjust to the width of the railing. The attachment clamp is portable and perfect for use on vacations. Measures approximately 18" high when assembled. Not recommended for soft or rounded crib railings. Extra assembly require for mobiles with closed attachment loops or closed loops at the top of their music box.

pTitle: JL Childress Crib Mobile Attachment Clamp, White
rText: Great idea, but when attached to a pack n play, the mobile is too heavy and it leans down into crib since the crib sides are soft. Even on the hard plastic corners it bows down. I ended up using just part of the mobile to make it lighter, but it still wasn't great. My mobile looks like ones in the pics for this item. My toddler could easily pull it down into the baby's pack n play.
rTitle: Not good for pack n play

pDescr: Four butterflies softly twirling overhead while the musical mobile plays Brahm's lullaby will surely help your little one doze off to slumber land. Mobile measures approximately 10" x 10" x 11" and is easy to install on your crib.
pTitle: Bedtime Originals Butterfly Meadow Musical Mobile
rText: The mobile is cute; however, the music is very short - it doesn't play for long at all when winded up all the way. It also sounds horrible, very clinkity and loud, but I am thinking that may be because there is no material covering the music box? I am not sure. I had ordered this one and a different one for the crib at my daughters grandmas house, and hers play much longer off one wind up, and it sounds so much nicer (it has the material cover over the music box). I don't use the music box much but my daughter still likes to gawk at the butterflies.

pDescr: Four butterflies softly twirling overhead while the musical mobile plays Brahm's lullaby will surely help your little one doze off to slumber land. Mobile measures approximately 10" x 10" x 11" and is easy to install on your crib.
pTitle: Bedtime Originals Butterfly Meadow Musical Mobile
rText: The mobile is good. I wish the plastic was stronger but it just hangs off the crib so it's not bad. It takes 9 turns to fully queue the music and that will last 3 minutes 45 seconds for my unit, I think it should be longer. The attachment point is 3.5 inches wide. The bars on our crib, from center to center are 3.5inches, I would have liked the attachment point to span further. Our unit is secure but a bit cattywompus. As for the butterflies, we chose this mobile because they faced down toward the child. A lot of figures, planes, animals, have there under side showing to the child. That can't be fun right? Overall I am happy with the unit. A few upgrades and it will be great.

pDescr: Four butterflies softly twirling overhead while the musical mobile plays Brahm's lullaby will surely help your little one doze off to slumber land. Mobile measures approximately 10" x 10" x 11" and is easy to install on your crib.
pTitle: Bedtime Originals Butterfly Meadow Musical Mobile
rText: I gave it 4 stars because the motor stopped spinning at the 6 o'clock position of the mobile motor one month after purchase. However, the music pitch is perfect, the volume is just right and my daughter adores the butterflies. When I contacted the manufacturer to inquire about where to purchase a new motor, they have offered to send me a new one free of charge, which gives their customer service a 5/5 Stars.

rText: As someone with no prior experience in developing apps (and certainly no experience in marketing them to the public), I found this book to be a great How-To guide to get me started with marketing my mobile app, Beeline Trip Planner. The author made it a point to emphasize the importance of keywords, which I greatly appreciated. He also gave great tips on how to market to the press, including links to create a press release which I have done! I feel much more knowledgeable having read this book.
rTitle: Great book! Clear & concise language that doesn't overwhelm the novice app developer.

pDescr: Not Available
pTitle: #N/A
rText: A concise well-written overview of the challenges a small business developer faces when trying to find an audience for an app in the stores. The manuscript is perfect for a beginner who needs guidance. There are some intermediate and advanced strategies too. The details of many of the marketing tactics are the highlight of this book. If you are a developer, you’ll have to look elsewhere for coding advice, as this author recommends that you learn coding to save money on outsourcing fees. Most of the app store optimization strategies discussed are still current in 2017. Genadinik covers both the Apple App Store and Google Play although he is primarily experienced with Android. App pricing models are examined. Mobile App Marketing and Monetization is a fast read. It is well worth it for exposure to the tips you may not be aware of.

pDescr: A daily routine helps baby adjust to the world around them. Including the Lullaby Mobile in baby's bedtime routine will create consistency at bedtime and comfort baby as they fall asleep. Let your newborn baby enjoy the soothing motion and soft design while lying in their crib and listening to the continuous music. Play the mobile's melodies at bedtime to help your baby find their way of falling asleep without your help. At 3-5 months, Enjoy hearing your baby coo and babble as they look at the cute animal figures overhead while you get a bit of me time.
pTitle: Tiny Love Lullaby Electronic Mobile Toy
rText: It is cute and, I'm sure, works well, EXCEPT it doesn't fit on a mesh-sided portable crib. The advertising says the universal connector will work on most cribs. Be aware it doesn't work on all. Disappointing.

pTitle: Tiny Love Lullaby Electronic Mobile Toy
rText: Super cute and works great. Fits the crib exactly as it should. I think the music is just the perfect level of sound. My newborn son is very restless at night so we wanted something to keep him busy/ distracted until he falls asleep.. this did the trick. He really enjoys the music more than watching the mobile so far but I'm sure he'll like that too when he gets a bit older. I like that it turns off after 30 minutes on its own so I don't have to get back up to do it too. That's nice when you're already feeling pretty sleep deprived- every second counts :)

rText: My son absolutely loves this mobile. When I turn it on his eyes get all wide and he gets a big smile. He "talks" to it as well. It plays a few different songs; maybe a little on the loud side, but you can have the mobile rotate without the music as well. We use his sound machine instead of the music. I feel like the quality is right for the price too. Would definitely recommend. You cannot see the mobile in my pic, but you can see his face is really happy :-)
rTitle: Adorable and my son loves it

pTitle: Tiny Love Lullaby Electronic Mobile Toy
rText:
I really wasn't too sure what to expect when I ordered this mobile. What attracted me most was the price! I couldn't justify spending $50 or more on a crib mobile, especially if my child didn't like it.
The best thing about this mobile is that you can have the mobile spin with or without music. The music is nice and not annoying. However is this little thing loud!!! It was wayyy to loud for my little one. I had to take painters tape and cover all but 2 of the speaker holes. Now it plays at a much softer volume and doesn't overwhelm my child.
I would definitely recommend this to friends.

Let your newborn baby enjoy the soothing motion and soft design while lying in their crib and listening to the continuous music. Play the mobile's melodies at bedtime to help your baby find their way of falling asleep without your help. At 3-5 months, Enjoy hearing your baby coo and babble as they look at the cute animal figures overhead while you get a bit of me time.
pTitle: Tiny Love Lullaby Electronic Mobile Toy
rText:
Adorable little mobile. It has cute little critters in bright fun colors. It is easy to attach to the crib by just turning a screw knob which tightens it down good and tight. It plays soft soothing music and the colors really grab the baby's eye and she seems to really love it.

Nice mobile but a little high price-wise (currently $29.99) when compared to similar mobiles.

pTitle: Tiny Love Lullaby Electronic Mobile Toy
rText: This is a very charming mobile toy for newborns and young infants. The soft toy animals are brightly colored with big eyes to catch baby's attention, and they revolve slowly to a soothing electronic music program that plays classical tunes like Bach's "Air on the G String" and Beethoven's "Moonlight Sonata". There is no volume control, but it plays at a level that's not loud or intrusive,and there is a silent setting that allows the mobile to turn without music. (The motor takes 3 AA batteries that are not included.) My only criticism is that it seems to be priced a bit high at about $45 list. Otherwise, it's a fine addition to baby's crib.

pTitle: Kreg KWS1000 Mobile Project Center,
rText:
I purchased two of these and I'm returning them for the following reasons:
1) With the wings folded up the work surface is not flat. The center clamp channel is approximately 3/8" above the work surface so any thing placed on the unit rocks on the center clamp channel - very unsteady. I contacted Kreg to discuss this defect - no response. It's impossible to determine if this is a design defect or a manufacturing problem. Manufacturing QC should have picked up on this problem, but, (my opinion) plants in China are not known for good QC practices or programs.
2) It is very easy to pinch your fingers in a number of places during setup or when folding up the unit for storage.
3) The product data on the Amazon web page lists the weight as 40 lbs. They weigh closer to 50 lbs. so it is near impossible to carry two of these at one time and any attempt to move a single unit up, or down, stairs is extremely difficult.

I think the concept is a good idea, but in this case the execution is somewhat lacking.

rText:
I bought two of these for my new workshop in my garage. I couldn't get the tables to perfectly align so there is only one connector keeping them together. They still hold in place, thankfully. The other thing that wasn't good is that the bottom is very cheap. With any amount of weight, the bottom will sag.
The stuff I do like are the clamps that attach to the sides to make it easy to clamp and cut wood, including the easy-to-use bench dogs when sanding and lifting projects up off the table.

pTitle: Kreg KWS1000 Mobile Project Center,
rText:
I've been needing a good set of sawhorses for a long time. Tried to get by with one of the cheap HF versions. My old pair of home build horses were showing their age and 5 gal buckets weren't hacking it. I stumbled across these while looking for another Kreg product. After watching a few videos and reviews I had to have them. The versatility is apparent. After seeing the features video I knew a dozen applications and configurations for what I've been struggling with present & future could be filled. They are like a Swiss Army knife in that regard and since I own other Kreg products, they work together and add value.

The first thing you'll notice is they are hefty, compared to the Workmate's and similar products, these have some steel in them. On first encounter, I wondered if they were the right choice. After picking them up and carrying them like they are intended by the handle in the bottom tray, it wasn't as much of a struggle as I thought it might be, they are balanced. Certainly way easier than my solid one piece wood sawhorses. They are easy to open & close, latches function smoothly. They are very stable when opened, the feet have a little give to them to allow for minor floor variations. Any concern about pinch points can be alleviated be simply carrying them and opening them as intended. When folded they will stand by themselves and as long as they aren't stored in a traffic area, there should be any issue with them falling over. They arrived well packaged and in spite of the boxes being beat up some, they were unscathed. They are shipped upside down.

You can create all kinds of additional & sacrificial surfaces if you choose. I'll probably fab up a metal surface to attach to the clamp channel so I can use it for welding. A 2x4 'H' is already in the works to mount my miter saw below the table surface. Being able to slide the Tables in either direction over the legs of the 'H' will allow me to support long & short pieces of lumber from either direction, plus offer easy to set work stops. There is a screw hole in the 2x4 support brackets if you want to attach them to the 2x4's for added security.

As for improvements & short comings. It would be nice if there were some kind of simple latch on one leg to keep them folded, and maybe some kind of latch to secure the table sections when folded down. The bottom tray really should have some kind of supporting metal hinge on either side to add some rigidity when opened. Not really and issue unless you want to put something on the bottom shelf which is rated at 25#. I would also be nice to have a little accessory storage on the unit but I think that can be fabbed up easy enough. Maybe a lid on the top table pockets to keep screws, bits etc. in place. The only other problem I have is they tout how the lip around the table is there to allow you to hang their boxes of screws while keeping them below the table surface. I couldn't find any way to hang my box of 2000 2-1/2" Blue-Coat screws. (Just kidding. I use a lot of Kreg screws!) With a little thinning of the bin lip, you could use the Akro bins and they would sit below the table surface alternately you could just attach the Akro hanger strip to the table edge.

They have a 3 year warranty, I don't really see anything in particular that would be a durability issue. As long as you use reasonable care working on the table surface, it should endure what would be expected of it.
rTitle: Exceptional product as with anything Kreg makes
